Package game.characters.enemies

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
city.cs.engine.Walker
game.characters.enemies.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
city.cs.engine.CollisionListener, city.cs.engine.StepListener, EventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
Fly, Snail
public class Enemy extends city.cs.engine.Walker implements city.cs.engine.StepListener, city.cs.engine.CollisionListener
Represents a generic enemy in the game. The enemy can patrol and follow the player within a certain range.

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(city.cs.engine.World world, float x, float y, Player player, Game game)
      Constructs an Enemy in the specified world. Sets up the enemy's position, collision listener, and step listener.
      Parameters:
      world - The physics world in which the enemy exists.
      x - The starting x-coordinate of the enemy's position.
      y - The starting y-coordinate of the enemy's position.
      player - The player character in the game.
      game - The main game instance.

  • Method Details

    • setImages

      public void setImages()
      Sets the images for the enemy's animations. This method should be overridden by subclasses to provide specific images.

    • preStep

      public void preStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
      Updates the enemy's behavior before each physics step. Prevents the enemy from falling and determines whether to patrol or follow the player.
      Specified by:
      preStep in interface city.cs.engine.StepListener
      Parameters:
      e - The step event triggered by the physics engine.

    • postStep

      public void postStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
      Updates the enemy's animation after each physics step. Changes the enemy's image based on its movement direction or idle state.
      Specified by:
      postStep in interface city.cs.engine.StepListener
      Parameters:
      e - The step event triggered by the physics engine.

    • collide

      public void collide(city.cs.engine.CollisionEvent e)
      Handles collision events between the enemy and the player. Damages the player, pushes the player back, and freezes the game if the player loses.
      Specified by:
      collide in interface city.cs.engine.CollisionListener
      Parameters:
      e - The collision event triggered by the physics engine.
